The settings below can safely be left at their defaults
Result: OK. LEDs not lighting up? Try a lower priority value

Please complete the setup in the app first

Your TV has been detected as a TCL or Google TV device. These TVs restrict apps from recording the screen by default.

This wizard will guide you through enabling the required permissions using ADB (Android Debug Bridge) which allows the app to grant itself the necessary permissions.

No computer required - everything happens on the TV itself!

First, we need to enable Developer Options on your TV:

1. Open Settings → Device Preferences → About
2. Find "Build" or "Build number"
3. Press OK/Select on it 7 times quickly
4. You'll see "You are now a developer!"

Click the button below to open Device Info, then press Back when done.

Now enable ADB over network:

1. Open Settings → Device Preferences → Developer options
2. Enable "USB debugging" (may be called "ADB debugging")
3. Enable "Network debugging" or "ADB over network"
4. You may see a port number like :5555

Click the button below to open Developer Options.
✗ ADB is not enabled yet. Please follow the steps above.

Now we'll connect to ADB and grant the required permissions.

When you click the button, you may see an "Allow USB debugging?" dialog. Make sure to:

1. Check "Always allow from this device"
2. Click "Allow"

This allows the app to grant itself permissions.
A dialog should appear asking to allow USB debugging. Please accept it (check \"Always allow\") and try again.
All permissions have been granted successfully. You can now use Hyperion Grabber to capture your TV screen.
